sub_title: Global Partnership Coordinator Right2Grow & Impact Broker at the Hunger Project
summary:
International development and child health professional, with 15+ years experience as an advisor, programme and grant (portfolio) manager in the public & health sector. Extensive experience in paediatric HIV grantmaking, global child health, and community leadership and systems strengthening in Africa. I’m also a volunteer at Care4Neo - the Dutch association of parents of children who are born premature, too small, or sick - as a member of the neonatal care research, science and guidelines working group. 
I am a team player and quick learner, accustomed to working in a multi-stakeholder and multicultural environment. Comfortable communicating and working with a range of stakeholders, including grass roots or community based organisations, major donors, international NGOs, government and UN representatives, scientific researchers and medical professionals. Strong academic background with both a MSc in Health Sciences and a MSc in Global Challenges (global health, climate change & ecosystems and international development).

What drives me?  
Combining professional expertise and lived experience, I am determined to improve the health and wellbeing of all children in this world; it is unacceptable that child rights are too often neglected and too many children die of preventable causes. Children’s chances in life, and even their survival, are largely determined by the place in the world a child is born and a child's family income. Addressing this inequity is at the heart of what I want to achieve. Because all children should grow up and develop in a safe, healthy and supportive environment!

education.field_of_study: Global Challenges: international development, global health & environment challenges
Child Health: a Global Perspective - Summer School

projects.title: Interim Policy Advisor at the Dutch Healthcare Authority (NZa)
projects.description:
The Dutch Healthcare Authority (NZa) is the supervisory body for all healthcare markets in the Netherlands. The NZa supervises both healthcare providers and health insurence companies.

As full time interim policy officer I worked on two projects. I was responsible for researching and proposing policy changes in the project 'Performance Based Financing: products and rules for Mental Health Care in 2012'. Besides that I was responsible for preparing the project initiation document, executing stakeholder analysis, desk research and stakeholder consultation in the project 'Strengthening Primary Mental Health Care', which led to an advise for the minister of Health, Welfare and Sports'.

projects.title: DBBC Forensic Health Care (Performance Based Financing) for the Ministry of Justice
projects.description:
Commissioned by the Ministry of Justice the national project DBBC (Diagnose Treatment and Security Combination) Forensic Healthcare was established by Capgemini Consulting. The DBBC projectteam supported forensic institutions and the Ministry of Justice with implementing a new performance based financing system for the forensic healthcare in the Netherlands. 

My task included, but weren't limited by: projectmanagement, accountmanagent for addiction treatment clinics and Penitentiary Psychiatric Centers (PPC), the preliminary research and evaluation of registration and accounting rules in consultation with policy makers and end users, projet communication and budget control.

projects.title: Electronic Patient File implementation for a Mental Health Care Institution
projects.description:
Karakter, an institution for child and adolescent psychiatry is concerned with the implementation of an Electronic Patient File  which captures and can recall all patient data digitally so that treatment staff is optimally supported.

As project officer I supported the programmanager in implementing the Electronic Patient File and was responsible for all project related communication to staff.

contributors.headline: Global Partnership Coordinator Right2Grow & Impact Broker at the Hunger Project

projects.title: Taskforce DBC GGZ for the Ministry of Health, Welfare and Sports
projects.description: Since January 1st 2008 mental health institutions, independent psychiatrists, psychologists, psychotherapists have to declare their services electronically in DBCs (Diagnose Treatment Combinations) to the health insurers of their clients. In the first year of the electronic declaration the traffic showed that this was still difficult to achieve. Commissioned by the ministry of Health, Welfare and Sports Capgemini Consulting founded the Task Force DBC Mental Health Care. Within the Task Force I was responsible for identifying and making sure problems in the electronic declaration traffic between the mental health care providers and health insurers were solved.

contributors.headline: Global Partnership Coordinator Right2Grow & Impact Broker at the Hunger Project

projects.title: Clinical Pathways for a Mental Healthcare Institution
projects.description:
In order to get more uniformity in the treatment, to carry out effectiveness measurements and to have better management control and negotiate with the healthcare insurers the 'short treatment for adults' section of GGZ Westelijk Noord Brabant started with describing clinical pathways for their patients. 

Together with my collegue I prepared and facilitated the kick off meeting about clinical pathways for mental health care and supported the various workgroups with their first concepts of their clinical pathway.

profile_positions.description:
Global coordination of the Right2Grow strategic partnership, which is implemented in Bangladesh, Burkina Faso, Ethiopia, Mali, South Sudan and Uganda. 
The Hunger Project Netherlands is the lead partner of the Right2Grow partnership, funded by the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs. Right2Grow combines the strength of six global partners (The Hunger Project, World Vision, Action Against Hunger, Save the Children, Max Foundation and Centre for Economic Governance and Accountability in Africa ) with the experience and knowledge of over 25 local civil society organisations. Together, these organisations strengthen civil society and amplify marginalised voices to get to zero undernutrition and zero people without access to basic WASH services. Because every child has the right to reach its full potential.
profile_positions.title: Global Partnership Coordinator - Right2Grow

profile_positions.description:
Member of the Management Team. Managing the Children’s Rights Expertise & Advice team with 7 legal professionals who provide individual legal advice to children, caregivers and professionals on child rights, give trainings and do research in child rights. Fundraising to ensure more diverse and sustainable funding base for the Child Rights Helpline. Hired to set up a Child Rights Expertise Centre. //
I worked briefly at Defence for Children; I decided to resign after realizing a misalignment between the job scope and context initially discussed and assigned duties. This allowed me to pursue new opportunities where I could better utilize my strengths and expertise.
profile_positions.title: Manager Children's Rights: Expertise and Advice

profile_positions.description: Developing and managing the Aidsfonds paediatric HIV grantmaking portfolio for the 2020-2025 strategic period in seven African countries (Kenya, Mozambique, Nigeria, Uganda, South Africa, Tanzania, Zimbabwe). Annual budget responsibility of ~2 million euro (secured funding), and fundraising for additional resources to grow our portfolio. Leading the paediatric HIV grantmaking project team. Core principles for our grants ant grantmaking: holistic and multidisciplinary approaches, community-based interventions, southern leadership, co-creation and country ownership.
profile_positions.title: Paediatric HIV grantmaking lead

profile_positions.description: Responsible for managing Aidsfonds funded community based paediatric HIV programmes in Sub-Saharan Africa (in Uganda, Kenya, Nigeria, South Africa), implemented by local NGOs and community-based organisations to prevent mother to child HIV transmission, and find, test and treat children living with HIV who are not yet in care. I'm also the Aidsfonds lead in the Paediatric Breakthrough Partnership, in which we work together with UNICEF, EGPAF and PATA with support from ViiV healthcare Positive Action. I'm also responsible to work with partners to identify best practices and lessons learnt in these programmes and making sure these are shared among partners and in regional and international networks. I advocate for increased investments in community responses to reach all children living with HIV and have been a member of the global steering committee of the Coalition for Children Affected by AIDS.
profile_positions.title: Senior Advisor Children affected by HIV
Senior Advisor Health and Community Systems / Global Programme Manager MaxART

profile_positions.description: Project management and policy advise, desk research and grant proposal writing for the Ethnic Minorities programme. Projects focused on supporting Dutch professionals with developing and implementing cultural-appropriate and community based STI and HIV prevention interventions in the Netherlands, in collaboration with community based and migrant organisations, government and public health service providers.
profile_positions.title: Senior Advisor Ethnic Minorities & MSM - STI AIDS the Netherlands

profile_positions.description: Assigned as projectmanager and senior advisor in different multi-stakeholder projects, primarily focusing on the implementation and optimization of performance based financing in the mental and forensic health care sector in the Netherlands. Clients included the Ministry of Justice, the Dutch Healthcare Authority (NZa) and several mental and forensic health care providers. Acted as the secretariat of the Expert (Steering) Committee for Financing Forensic Care.
profile_positions.title: Senior Management Consultant Health Care

profile_positions.description: Assigned as project officer and communications advisor to different multi-stakeholder projects, primarily focusing on the implementation or optimization of performance based financing in the mental and forensic health care sector in the Netherlands. Clients included the Ministry of Health, the Ministry of Justice and several mental and forensic health care providers.
profile_positions.title: Management Consultant Health Care

profile_positions.description:
ResCon is a small research and consultancy firm with a focus on health promotion and sustainable energy consumption. I was responsible for conducting applied (social) scientific research, evaluation studies as well as literature research in the field of public health, health promotion and the environment. 
Clients included: Soa Aids Nederland (STI AIDS the Netherlands), Dutch Ministry of Health and National Institute for Public Health and the Environment (RIVM), GGD Nederland (Association of Regional Public Health Services), Dutch Diabetes Federation, Novartis, Inmerc, Maastricht University, Consumer Safety (now: VeiligheidNL), and SenterNovem.
profile_positions.title: Researcher

volunteer_experiences.role: Member of Scientific Research and Medical Guidelines Working Group
volunteer_experiences.description: Care4Neo is a Dutch association of parents of children and children who were born small, sick or premature. It represents the interests of and provides support to parents and their children who need neonatal (intensive) care right after birth. In this voluntary position I provide feedback to health care guidelines that are being revised and to scientific research proposals and reports from a parental perspective, representing parents whose children are born premature, sick or too small for gestational age, including those parents who have lost a child.

Foundation Samen Lachen (Smile Together), previously Laat Ze Maar Lachen, is organising activities for children who grow up in poverty in the Netherlands, to make sure all children have a chance of a nice day out. I have volunteered in several roles, starting as a volunteer who supervises a group of children during our activities, after that by coordinating the activities in Amsterdam, and finally as a board member.
Raise awareness about SOS Kinderdorpen, and raise funds for SOS Kinderdorpen in Amsterdam.
Giving ‘guest lectures’ at primary schools in the Netherlands about children in developing countries, their daily lives and challenges they face
